home.heroDesc: Governador Celso Ramos with over 40 beaches and preserved Azorean tradition. Home to approximately 100 dolphins, migratory whales, and one of the best diving spots in Brazil. The municipality combines sustainable tourism, authentic artisanal fishing, and a welcoming community.

home.welcomeDesc: We prepared this guide with care so you can have the best possible experience in Governador Celso Ramos. Here you'll find tips on beaches, restaurants, tours, and everything you need to know to make the most of your stay with us.

silence.title: Quiet Hours
silence.desc: Respect quiet hours between 10 PM and 8 AM. Parties and excessive noise are not allowed.

guests.title: Guests
guests.desc: The maximum number of guests is as stated in the reservation. You cannot bring extra people without authorization.

smoking.title: No Smoking
smoking.desc: Smoking is not allowed inside the house. You may smoke in the outdoor area, respecting neighbors.

pets.title: Pets
pets.desc: Pets are not allowed in the property.

trash.title: Trash and Cleaning
trash.desc: Leave the house clean and dispose of trash properly. Use the provided trash bins.

parking.title: Parking
parking.desc: Use only the parking space reserved for your property. Street parking is prohibited.

security.title: Security
security.desc: Monitored environment with cameras for your safety and property protection.

beaches.pageSubtitle: Governador Celso Ramos is surrounded by incredible beaches. Check out our recommendations!
beaches.note: Note: "Sea", "Access" and "Parking" are a general guide and may vary according to tide, wind and season.

items.name: Palmas Beach
items.desc: The most popular in the region, with calm waters and good infrastructure of kiosks and restaurants. Ideal for families.

items.name: Arma√ß√£o da Piedade Beach
items.desc: Charming fishing beach with a view of Anhatomirim Island. Great for photos and sunsets.

items.name: Ganchos de Fora Beach
items.desc: Quiet beach with crystal-clear waters, perfect for those seeking peace and contact with nature.

items.name: Antenor Beach
items.desc: Small and secluded, ideal for snorkeling and appreciating local marine life.

items.name: Calheiros Beach
items.desc: Preserved beach with incredible views. Access via a short trail, worth every step!

items.name: Marcelo Beach (or Funil Beach)
items.desc: A small, hidden gem in Canto dos Ganchos; you may see both names for the same place.

tours.pageSubtitle: Tour ideas to enjoy Governador Celso Ramos ‚Äî choose your style.
tours.tip: Tip: on trails, bring water, wear closed shoes and avoid going alone. On boat tours, confirm the day's route and sea conditions.

items.name: Anhatomirim Island Tour (Fortress)
items.desc: Boat trip with a visit to the Santa Cruz Fortress and navigation through beautiful areas of the bay.

items.name: Pirate Ship Tour
items.desc: Themed tour, fun for families/groups; usually passes through points in the region and may include a swimming stop (depending on the day's route).

items.name: Dolphin Bay Tour
items.desc: Bay navigation with a chance of sightings; combine with Anhatomirim for a complete itinerary.

items.name: Trail to Praia de Fora
items.desc: Trail with beautiful scenery and a more preserved beach; bring water and wear appropriate footwear.

items.name: Trail to Praia do Sissial
items.desc: Preserved beach surrounded by forest, accessed by trail; great for those who want a more authentic place.

items.name: Trail to Praia das Conchas
items.desc: Famous trail leading to a unique beach with many shells; the path passes through coastal stretches and small beaches.
